example.text: This past week the Biden Administration reversed that policy and released Viktor Bout, a dangerous terrorist who the world knows as the "Merchant of Death," to bring one wrongfully detained American home. Regardless of why the Biden Administration worked to secure the release of Brittney Griner while leaving the other Americans, Paul Whelan and Marc Fogel, behind, releasing an individual who was criminally convicted of Conspiring to Kill Americans and Conspiring to Provide Material Support to Terrorists was a horrible decision that put every American traveling abroad at increased risk.

Celebrating India Cutting Tariffs on US Pecan Exports After a Years-Long Bipartisian Push Much of the global supply of pecans is grown right here in Georgia, and after years of bipartisan work in the House, India's Government decided to reduce tariffs on US pecan exports by 70% and allow us into their growing market. This has been in the works for a long time, and last year I met with ambassadors in India and discussed this issue.

This bill takes necessary action against Chinese and Russian aggression, increases President's Biden proposed defense budget by $45 billion, and will ensure our military is better funded, equipped, trained, and ready to fight in these dangerous times. I'm particularly proud of the amendments I sponsored that will increase our military's ability to operate with key partners, including establishing a partnership program with Ukraine for research on military trauma care and an amendment expressing the need for joint exercises with Taiwan.

Relationships like these are critical to overcoming threats from Russia and communist China and ensuring democracy continues to thrive. Moreover, I am very proud of the relationship between the Georgia National Guard and the country of Georgia's Armed Forces as part of the State Partnership Program.

This bill takes necessary action against Chinese and Russian aggression, increases President's Biden proposed defense budget by $45 billion, and will ensure our military is better funded, equipped, trained, and ready to fight in these dangerous times. I'm particularly proud of the amendments I sponsored that will increase our military's ability to operate with key partners, including establishing a partnership program with Ukraine for research on military trauma care and an amendment expressing the need for joint exercises with Taiwan.
